column4: Hi.  I have gotten my dhcp3-server service running, and it is successfully assigning my client an IP address.  However, that client's packets are not being forwarded to the internet.  any ideas why this might happen?
Sounds that the router might not be properly configured
howso, though?  It's like it's doing DHCP, but not NAT.
why would it do that?
Have you tried to wireshark over your network?
listening for what?
If I understand your PC is a DHCP and the router?
yes
listening from when your client connects to when it tries to ping google.com for instance
i suspect i will see the incoming packets but this box just won't forward them out
what if you assign to your client the Ip manually?
doesn't work either
but the DHCP part of things now seems to be working fine
ok so it's definitely not a dhcp issue
well you have to configure the router feature, NAT/PAT and so on
doesnt dhcpd-3 deal with all of that?
maybe it's a firewall blocking outgoing traffic
no, i enabled all traffic in iptables
a DHCP server is not a router
so what takes care of the NAT stuff then?
i don't know how to implement that on a PC but you've got to find a software that will do the routing and NAT/PAT i guess
DHCP and IP routing are different processes, the DHCP server and router can be different machines also
